yoruba: Ẹni à ńgbé gẹ̀gẹ̀ ni yó ba ara-a rẹ̀ jẹ́.
gold: It is the person who is revered that will disgrace himself or herself.
gen: The Yoruba proverb "Ẹni à ńgbé gẹ̀gẹ̀ ni yó ba ara-a rẹ̀ jẹ" translates to "He who is being carried like a cripple will eventually harm himself" in English. This proverb suggests that relying too much on others or not taking responsibility for oneself can lead to negative consequences.
